Pre-Game Insights: Lee Carsley's decision to start without a striker in the absence of the injured Harry Kane backfired.
It now seems highly unlikely the interim boss will be given the full-time gig as Gareth Southgate's successor.
Kane could return to the starting XI and has fond memories of facing Finland after scoring a second-half brace on his 100th England appearance in last month's reverse fixture.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Three Lions are the heavy favourites to claim all three points, as Finland have lost all three of their Nations League games and prop up the table.
Others: Finland v England will take place on Sunday 13th October 2024.
Finland v England will kick off at 5pm.
Finland v England will be shown live on ITV1 with live coverage from 4:15pm.
You can also live stream Finland v England online via ITVX.
The streaming platform is available on a range of devices, from desktop and laptop computers to smartphones and tablets via the app.
You can listen to the match on BBC Radio 5 Live and talkSPORT.
